text: Hey, have you been able to solve this? I have the same issue right now.

Hi Guys,
Can I Create HubSpot workflows Through APIâ€™s for objects of type other than Contacts some how?
<@UGDF9EBPW> sorry to ping you, but maybe you have an idea on this?

Morning guys, someone can help me?
How can i include this property in the request?

Did anyone used the `country` when creating a list through the API?
If I check an existing list using this property in HS it looks like:
```{
  "filterType":"PROPERTY",
  property":"country",
  operation":{
    propertyType":"enumeration",
    operator":"IS_ANY_OF",
    values":["Spain"],
    defaultValue":null,
    includeObjectsWithNoValueSet":false,
    operationType":"enumeration",
    operatorName":"IS_ANY_OF"
  }
} ```
But if I try to create a list with the very same response as I get when checking the existing list I get this error:
```{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "{\"status\":\"error\",\"message\":\"Operator LT is not valid for this property type enumeration. Filter: property: \\\"country\\\"\\ntype: enumeration\\nwithin_last_time_mode: PAST\\nfilter_family: PropertyValue\\n\",\"correlationId\":\"f6e8a80c-fc0b-4ac7-8adc-980e1c48c0f7\"}",
    "correlationId": "f6e8a80c-fc0b-4ac7-8adc-980e1c48c0f7"
}```
:thinking_face:
Nice
When using the Form Submit API, how do you send in enumeration values?
As an array I believe just like the normal api
"field values should match the contacts api"
Do you want to try this with the v3 endpoint? */account-info/v3/api-usage/daily*
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/account-information-api>
I would highly highly recommend using this api instead so that you don't have to expose your private app key on your website, <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>
This api will also allow you to create the contacts as marketing contacts if you provide the legal consent
Also this article will help you if you want to continue down the route of using the contacts api <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/integrations/manage-marketing-contacts-settings-for-your-integrations>
unfortunately at this time no, per <@U0157R7AQ84> this might change in a couple of month hopefully
Thanks Carter, same error, used this url:
string url = string.Format("<https://api.hubapi.com/account-info/v3/api-usage/daily>");
Dang ok running a couple of tests on my end
Yep ok so that endpoint currently only supports Hapikeys
so Hapikeys will continue to work for that call?
You can always just make a call to the contacts endpoint and then check the response headers to see the remaining calls
Correct hapikeys will work for that endpoint
That works, like that better so I don't get bit by the hapi key at some point in the future...
so I better go back and check all my endpoints and see what else has "API Key"  :disappointed:
Thanks again, going to finish up another project working on tonight and will go at this tomorrow :)
Really only a couple of endpoints don't support private apps yet
but more and more are coming online soon
Cool, prefer to get off them so dont have to come back and update later, i like using contacts for getting the counts!
CC <@U03MLCLS5BN> do you think you can bring this up to the team?
Yeah the contacts approach isn't a terrible one

<@U046MB5T9LH> currently it looks like that endpoint is only supported by hapikeys, best solution for now is to either use a hapikey or just call another api and check the response headers. here's another post <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1669928020215599>
I like it will give it a shot, thanks again!
